testcase.purpose: Test that the user agent skips a content element that points to a non-existing file and shouldn't read the following content element.
Test the UA's support for explicitly setting the valid mime type of a file using the type attribute of the content element.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of dc.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the dc.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/dc.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Get the 'application id' of dc.wgt with the command :"xwalkctl" and launch the dc.wgt with the command :"xwalk-launcher 'application id'".
step.expected: To pass, the widget can be started successfully and the screen shows "PASS" on green background.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can verify a cryptographic zip archive.
Test that an empty defaultlocale attribute is ignored (and does not cause the widget to be treated as an invalid one).
Test that the UA only checks the config files in the root of the widget package which are not in a locale folder.
Test that the user agent rejects malformed XML.
Test if the UA can treat file names in the default start files table case-sensitively (and the file is named 'INdeX.html' in a locale folder).
Test if the UA can treat file names in the default start files table case-sensitively (and the file is named 'INdeX.HTM' in a locale folder).
Test if the UA can treat file names in the default start files table case-sensitively (and the file is named 'INdeX.htm' in the root of the widget package).
Test if the UA can locate the icon at the root of the widget package.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of bj.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the bj.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/bj.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Check the bj widget logo.
step.expected: To pass, the user agent must select black "PASS" on the round green background as the widget logo.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can locate the icon in a locale folder and at the root of the widget package.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can process the various values applicable to the viewmodes attribute of the widget element.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of viewb.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the viewb.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/viewb.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Get the 'application id' of viewb.wgt with the command :"xwalkctl" and launch the viewb.wgt with the command :"xwalk-launcher 'application id'".
step.expected: To pass, the widget can be started successfully and the screen shows "PASS" on green background.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can process a viewmodes attribute containing an unsupported value.

step.expected: To pass, the widget can be started successfully and the screen shows "PASS" on green background.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can ignore a file which contains the garbage data and can't be processed as an icon format.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of za.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the za.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/za.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Check the za widget logo.
step.expected: To pass, the user agent must select black "PASS" on the round green background as the widget logo.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can ignore subsequent declarations to use the same icon.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of zc.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the zc.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/zc.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Check the zc widget logo.
step.expected: To pass, the user agent must select black "PASS" or "PASS ROOT" on the round green background as the widget logo.

testcase.purpose: Test if the UA can correctly deal with an icon element that points to a file which is not present in the widget package.

description.post_condition: Get the 'pkgid' of zz.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -l, then uninstall the zz.wgt with the command : pkgcmd -u -t wgt -q -n 'pkgid'

step.step_desc: Install the widget with the command: pkgcmd -i -t wgt -q -p /home/app/content/tct/opt/tct-widget02-w3c-tests/widgetpackaging/w3c/zz.wgt
step.expected: Widget application is able to be installed successfully.

step.step_desc: Check the zz widget logo.
step.expected: To pass, the icon should be empty or a default icon in the system.

testcase.purpose: Test that the default locale is added to the end of the user agent's locale list (and does not override the default language, which is assumed to be 'en').
